climbs.name: Welcome to My World
climbs.fa: David Wolfe, Leland Windham, Steve Martin, Alex McMillan, 09/2004

content.description: Wandering and runout. The third bolt is barely attached to the rock and one of the anchor bolts is loose.
content.protection: 6 bolts; chains. Some place a supplemental 3" cam.
content.location: Just right of the vegetated corner.

content.description: Decent practice route if you want to work on placing a good amount of gear with minimal risk of fall. If you want to keep going, you can head up to the second set of chains off the top of Little Bird or Huckleberry Heaven (Can't remember).
content.location: The large crack when you first arrive at West Wall.

climbs.name: Shadow Gold
climbs.fa: David Whitelaw, Leland Windham, David Argento, David Smith, David Wolf

content.description: The route is a precise down leaning face, it requires good footwork but isnt very pumpy however sections of the route require good Beta otherwise it will feel like an 11.
content.location: This route is directly right of An Alpine Embrace as Meteors Race and a easy to get to blocky ledge above the trail. This route can be Â climbed both right, left or on both sides of the bolt line. The right side has a lot of vegetation, lose rock and some ferns. Further to the right on the ledge is a Trad route called Wilderness Experience and a sport route called Welcome to My World.

content.description: An easy climb and great warm-up for some of the other routes. The guidebook says "this was named for the curious pikas that greet visitors. Meep!"
content.location: The 4th route from the left, this route begins in a short corner with the first bold in a rock scar.

content.description: Short, hard to keep it easy. Stay left for big holds. Don't blow it near third clip.
content.location: Leftmost bolted route at the crag

climbs.name: Huckleberry Heaven
climbs.fa: Leland Windham, Lauri jae Sweetland, Jul 2007

content.description: Nice intro to the crag. Climb up a slab and through 2 tiny roofs.
content.location: Easy to find--after you get to West Wall, just look to the left for the two mini roofs. It's the second line of bolts--just to the right of Little Bird.

climbs.name: An Alpine Embrace as Meteors Race
climbs.fa: Leland Windham, Brandon and Heather Kern, Jul 2005

content.description: This is listed as a 5.9 in the guidebook, which seemed a little soft.
content.location: This route is the fourth line of bolts from the left on West Wall. It wasn't drawn on the topo, so we ended up confusing it for the 5.7 next door and then looking for the missing bolt.
